|wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot=rtkload; |stock_os=Linux; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router |default_ssid_regex=^SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:D0:41 |oui_eth=00:D0:41 |default_ch= }} {{TagLine|N+ Broadband Router - All Broadbands}} There appears to be a v1 and v2 of this device. I don't know what the difference between versions is.. "EPMBBR380NBXX3XX", "BR380n_MB_V30", and a date code of '''1030''' is silkscreened on the board of the particular unit populating this entry. The default SSID of the wireless interface is '''SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router'''. The default Universal Repeater Mode SSID is '''ESSID_SAPIDO_RB-1232'''. The default SSIDs for multi-SSID mode are '''Multiple_APX''', where X is 1 through 4. ==Serial== ===Pinout=== The pinout would appear to be the following... 
T1
[3.3] (TxD) (RxD) (GND)

==Included PSU(s)== The included power adapter for at least some units is a '''Channel Well Technology''' CAP008051. {{hasPowerSupply |brand=Channel Well Technology |model=CAP008051 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.25 |input_c=AC |input_hz=47-63 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=5 |output_a=1.5 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |style=medium, horiz. |manuf_country=China |e_level=5 }}
